author: Stuart Williams
title: French far right, Macron camp clash over Le Pen army warning
text:
Tensions soared Thursday between supporters of Emmanuel Macron and the French far right after its longtime leader Marine Le Pen cast doubt on the president's ability to act as head of the armed forces as snap legislative elections loom.
The far-right National Rally (RN) is tipped to win the election, potentially giving Le Pen's party the post of prime minister for the first time in its history in a tense "cohabitation" with Macron.

author: Thursday
title: The Hidden Horror Of Cheap Website Design In Auckland: Real Stories, Real Losses | Scoop News
text:
Imagine this: You’ve just launched your dream business. Your products are ready. Your branding looks slick. You hire someone for a cheap website because, hey — “it’s just a website,” right?
They promise you the world for $500. Two weeks later, your site is live.
But then…
Your traffic flatlines.
No one’s calling.
Customers message saying your website “won’t load” or “looks like a scam.” And when you Google your business? You're not even on page 10.
Welcome to the digital graveyard — where
poor website
design Auckland sends good businesses to
die.
Real Talk: This Happens Every Week in Auckland
We’ve spoken with dozens of frustrated business owners across the city. Each one shares a chillingly similar story:
“I paid a freelancer on Fiverr…”
“I built it on Wix to save money…”
“I didn’t know SEO mattered…”
“It looked fine on desktop, but it’s broken on mobile…”
The result?
They lost time. They lost credibility. They lost customers. And in some cases, they lost the entire business.
All
because they underestimated the power of professional website
design Auckland.
If Your Website Isn’t Converting, You’re Already Losing
People judge your business in under 3 seconds. And what does a slow, ugly, or broken website say about you?
- “Untrustworthy.”
- “Unprofessional.”
- “Don’t buy from here.”
Your website is your first impression. And in this fast-paced world — there are no second chances.
Let’s be clear: a bad website doesn’t just “do nothing” — it actively repels your customers and pushes them straight to your competitors.
The Fix? Strategic, High-Converting Website Design in Auckland
At Ultimate Web
Designs, we don’t just build websites — we create
powerful digital sales machines.
Our website
design Auckland services are trusted by over
1000 businesses across New Zealand.
We deliver:
- Blazing-fast load times (under 5 seconds)
- Stunning, mobile-optimised designs
- SEO-optimised structure from day one
- Smart layouts that convert visitors into leads
- Full support before, during, and after launch
We fix the mess others leave behind. We future-proof your business online.
So if you're ready
to stop bleeding leads and wasting time — get in touch
with the website
design Auckland experts that business owners
recommend again and again.
Don’t Wait Until It’s Too Late
Every day you delay is another day your potential customers choose someone else.
You deserve
more than a basic, broken site. You deserve a smart,
search-ready, customer-converting digital presence. And
you’ll get it — with professional website
design Auckland that actually
works.
Don’t let your business join the graveyard of forgotten websites.
Rise above with a team that’s local, proven, and obsessed with your success.

author: 長野地方気象台
title: 気象特別警報・警報・注意報

author: Staff Writer
title: The Top 5 Samsung Scanner Printer Software Solutions for Enhanced Efficiency
text:
In today’s fast-paced digital world, having efficient and reliable scanning and printing solutions is essential for businesses of all sizes. Samsung, a renowned brand in the technology industry, offers a range of scanner printer software solutions that can greatly enhance productivity and streamline workflows. In this article, we will explore the top five Samsung scanner printer software solutions that can help businesses achieve enhanced efficiency.
Easy Printer Manager
One of the most popular software solutions from Samsung is Easy Printer Manager. This comprehensive tool allows users to manage multiple printers from a single interface, making it incredibly convenient for businesses with several devices. With Easy Printer Manager, you can monitor the status of each printer in real-time, receive alerts when supplies are running low, and even order new cartridges directly from the software. Additionally, this software enables you to configure various settings such as print quality and paper size for each printer individually or apply them globally to ensure consistent output across all devices.
SmarThru Office
SmarThru Office is another powerful scanner printer software solution offered by Samsung. Designed specifically for document management purposes, this software allows users to scan documents directly into various file formats such as PDF or TIFF. It also offers advanced features like optical character recognition (OCR) which enables you to convert scanned documents into editable text files. With SmarThru Office, you can easily organize your scanned documents into folders and subfolders, making it effortless to locate specific files when needed.
SyncThru Web Service
For businesses looking for remote management capabilities, SyncThru Web Service is an excellent choice. This cloud-based scanner printer software solution allows administrators to monitor and control their Samsung printers remotely through a web browser interface. With SyncThru Web Service, you can view detailed information about each device’s status, including toner levels, paper jams, and error messages. You can also manage printer settings, update firmware, and even schedule maintenance tasks without having to physically be near the printers. This software solution is especially beneficial for businesses with multiple locations or remote workers.
Samsung Scan Assistant
Samsung Scan Assistant is a user-friendly software solution that simplifies the scanning process. This software offers various scanning options, including single-sided or double-sided scanning, color or black and white, and different file formats. With Samsung Scan Assistant, you can easily create searchable PDFs by utilizing the OCR feature, making it effortless to find specific information within scanned documents. The intuitive interface allows users to customize scan settings according to their preferences and requirements, ensuring optimal results every time.
Easy Document Creator
Last but not least, Easy Document Creator is a versatile scanner printer software solution that caters to businesses with diverse document creation needs. With this software, you can create professional-looking documents by combining scanned images with text files or other digital content seamlessly. Easy Document Creator offers various templates and editing tools that allow you to add annotations, stamps, or watermarks to your documents effortlessly. This software also supports batch scanning and printing, enabling you to process multiple documents simultaneously for maximum efficiency.
In conclusion, investing in high-quality scanner printer software solutions is crucial for businesses seeking enhanced efficiency in their document management processes. Samsung offers a range of top-notch options such as Easy Printer Manager, SmarThru Office, SyncThru Web Service, Samsung Scan Assistant, and Easy Document Creator that cater to different needs and requirements. By leveraging these software solutions effectively, businesses can streamline workflows, improve productivity, and ultimately achieve their goals more efficiently in today’s digital age.
This text was generated using a large language model, and select text has been reviewed and moderated for purposes such as readability.

author: Agenzia ANSA
title: Vanessa Ballan, i funerali nel lutto regionale. Il vescovo: "Serve una civiltà che rifiuti la violenza sulle donne" - Notizie - Ansa.it
text: Nel Duomo di Castelfranco Veneto i funerali di Vanessa Ballan, 26 anni, uccisa a coltellate il 19 dicembre. In carcere, accusato dell'omicidio, Bunjar Fandaj, 41 anni. Per il giorno dei funerali il presidente della regione del Veneto Luca Zaia ha proclamato il lutto regionale. "È troppo grande quanto è accaduto, è troppo al di fuori di ogni pur pessimistica previsione", ha detto nel duomo il vescovo di Treviso Michele Tomasi nell'omelia. "Non c'è un motivo al mondo che giustifichi questo atto, questa violenza. Non c'è mai. Non c'è sicuramente nel caso di Vanessa - ha aggiunto - e della creatura che lei portava in grembo". Per il prelato "non c'è un senso nella sua brutale uccisione. Questa è il male. E con il male non possiamo, non abbiamo il diritto di venire a patti". Monsignor Tomasi ha chiesto "il silenzio dai clamori e dalle curiosità. Silenzio della memoria e delle emozioni più negative. Silenzio della preghiera che invoca la consolazione delle vittime e la conversione dei violenti. Non certo il silenzio della ricerca della giustizia - ha puntualizzato - e nemmeno il silenzio nell'impegno per una civiltà che rifiuti nelle parole, negli atti e nei fatti la violenza sulle donne, e che superi finalmente la follia di voler possedere una persona, o di volerne determinare con la violenza le scelte e le decisioni". "Abbiamo tanta rabbia perché non doveva succedere. Non devono più succedere. Io mi chiedo a questo punto a cosa servano le leggi", ha detto, poco prima dell'inizio del funerale, una collega del supermercato dove lavorava Vanessa Ballan . "Noi - racconta - avevamo paura quando Fardaj - l'uomo arrestato per l'omicidio, ndr - entrava in negozio, il suo sguardo non mi piaceva". Bunjar Fandaj, attualmente in carcere a Treviso perché accusato dell'omicidio, avrebbe indirizzato al telefonino del compagno e non alla vittima l'ultima comunicazione via whatsapp, quella che gli è costata la denuncia sporta dalla coppia a fine ottobre. E' quanto emergerebbe dalle indagini dei Carabinieri. Nel messaggio giunto a Nicola Scapinello, Fandaj avrebbe fatto riferimenti espliciti alla natura del rapporto Vanessa, accompagnati anche da un video. Per questo Vanessa e Nicola, di comune accordo, avrebbero preso la decisione di andare insieme dai militari per sporgere querela. La giovane avrebbe raccontato al compagno di aver chiuso la storia con il quarantenne e per questo di essere stata ricattata. Relazioni a Nordio sul perché dei mancati interventi Sono in fase di ultimazione le relazioni che i magistrati della Procura di Treviso invieranno all'Ispettorato del Ministero di Grazie e Giustizia con i motivi per i quali, alla denuncia di Vanessa Ballan nei confronti del suo futuro assassino, Bunjar Fandaj, non fece seguito alcuna misura cautelare. Le relazioni, dei due pm, Valmassoi e Sabattini, e del procuratore capo di Treviso Marco Martani, saranno inviate tramite la Procura Generale di Venezia all'ispettorato del Ministero, e anche come risposta all'interrogazione diretta al ministro Nordio presentata in Senato dal leghista Gian Marco Centinaio. "Finiremo al ministero nel più breve tempo possibile - ha detto il procuratore Martani, sulla stampa locale - le relazioni dei due pubblici ministeri, quello che era di turno (quando Vanessa presentò la denuncia per stalking, ndr) e quello che fa parte del gruppo speciale per i reati da 'codice rosso'". Sui mancati provvedimenti cautelari, come il divieto di avvicinamento, il magistrato ha detto che questa valutazione verrà spiegata al Guardasigilli. Il procuratore ha negato che sul caso "non sia stato fatto niente", ricordando che fu subito disposta una perquisizione in casa di Bunjar. Ma in assenza dei riscontri sui messaggi intimidatori mandati dall'uomo a Vanessa (Ballan li aveva cancellati dal suo cellulare) la valutazione dei pm sul caso era stata "di non urgenza", come aveva ammesso nei giorni scorsi lo stesso Martani. Riproduzione riservata © Copyright ANSA
